description: Enbridge Inc on Monday named its Chairman Greg Ebel as the new chief executive, replacing Al Monaco who will retire after a decade at the helm of Canada's biggest pipeline operator during which it faced fierce opposition from environmentalists.  Ebel, 57, who has been board chair since 2017, will start his new role on Jan. 1, 2023.  Prior to that, he was CEO of pipeline company Spectra Energy, which Enbridge acquired in a C$37 billion ($27.1 billion) deal.
title: - UPDATE 2-Canada's Enbridge names Chairman Ebel as CEO, replacing Monaco who retires after 10 years
